title: Douglass on Quaker activism - identify process

content.question: Douglass’s statement that, by embracing a “self-denying life,” she “no longer felt disturbed as to whether my appearance was better than my neighbor or not, and I always had something for the poor” best illustrates which of the following?

choices.label: Many Black women supported the women’s suffrage movement in addition to the abolition of slavery.
Many Black women used their life experiences to highlight the connections between race and class in the African American community.
Many Black women emphasized their American identity by rejecting the term “African,” preferring the term “African American.”
Some Black women used political speeches and published pamphlets as vehicles for their political activism.

content.answer: Many Black women used their life experiences to highlight the connections between race and class in the African American community.

topic.text: 2.14: Black Organizing in the North: Freedom, Women's Rights, and Education

skill.text: 1.B: Identify and explain the context of a specific event, development, or process.
